files.name: package.gno
files.body:
package runtime

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}

	default:

files.body:
package runtime

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}

files.body:
package runtime

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}

files.name: whitepaper.gno
files.body:
// HISTORIA White Paper - On-chain version
// Immutable documentation stored on Gno.land blockchain
package whitepaper

const (
	version = "1.0"
	date    = "February 2025"
)

// Render returns the white paper content
func Render(path string) string {
	if path == "" {
		return renderFullWhitepaper()
	}

	switch path {
	case "toc":
		return renderTOC()
	case "philosophy":
		return renderPhilosophy()
	case "problem":
		return renderProblem()
	case "solution":
		return renderSolution()
	case "technical":
		return renderTechnical()
	case "economics":
		return renderEconomics()
	case "security":
		return renderSecurity()
	case "roadmap":
		return renderRoadmap()
	default:
		return renderFullWhitepaper()
	}
}

func renderFullWhitepaper() string {
	out := "# HISTORIA\n"
	out += "## White Paper v" + version + ": The Registry of Epistemological Truth\n"
	out += "### Decentralized Protocol for Collective Memory on Gno.land\n\n"
	out += "**Version**: " + version + " | **Date**: " + date + "\n\n"
	out += "---\n\n"

	out += renderPhilosophy()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderProblem()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderSolution()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderTechnical()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderEconomics()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderSecurity()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderRoadmap()
	out += "\n---\n\n"
	out += renderConclusion()

	return out
}

func renderTOC() string {
	out := "# HISTORIA White Paper - Table of Contents\n\n"
	out += "1. [Philosophy & Vision](whitepaper:philosophy)\n"
	out += "2. [Problem Statement](whitepaper:problem)\n"
	out += "3. [Solution](whitepaper:solution)\n"
	out += "4. [Technical Architecture](whitepaper:technical)\n"
	out += "5. [Economic Model](whitepaper:economics)\n"
	out += "6. [Security](whitepaper:security)\n"
	out += "7. [Roadmap](whitepaper:roadmap)\n\n"
	out += "[Read Full White Paper](whitepaper:)\n"
	return out
}

func renderPhilosophy() string {
	out := "## 1. Philosophy & Vision\n\n"
	out += "### The Distinction Between Reality and Truth\n\n"
	out += "The foundation of HISTORIA rests on an essential philosophical nuance: "
	out += "the distinction between **Reality** and **Truth**.\n\n"
	out += "**Reality** is a factual, immutable, absolute state.\n\n"
	out += "**Truth** is a human construction—a version of reality validated by knowledge, "
	out += "evidence, and the consensus of a given era.\n\n"
	out += "#### The Example of the Earth's Shape\n\n"
	out += "The **Reality** of the Earth's shape has never changed. Yet, the **Truth** about it "
	out += "has radically evolved. During the Renaissance, the collective conviction in a flat Earth "
	out += "was as unshakeable as our current certainty of its sphericity.\n\n"
	out += "**HISTORIA does not claim to capture absolute Reality, but to archive the Truth of the Moment.**\n\n"
	out += "### Our Vision\n\n"
	out += "HISTORIA serves as a **timeline of the evolution of human thought**. "
	out += "By archiving economic and social consensus at a moment T, the protocol protects "
	out += "each stage of our understanding against forgetting or retroactive revisionism.\n\n"
	out += "We create a system where:\n\n"
	out += "- **Truth is verified, not dictated.**\n"
	out += "- **Economic alignment ensures honesty.**\n"
	out += "- **Epistemological humility is the rule**: we accept that today's truth may be tomorrow's historical curiosity.\n"
	return out
}

func renderProblem() string {
	out := "## 2. Problem Statement\n\n"
	out += "### Centralized Revisionism\n\n"
	out += "Current databases (Wikipedia, state servers) are mutable. "
	out += "A past truth can be erased to match present needs.\n\n"
	out += "### Crisis of Trust\n\n"
	out += "The absence of \"skin in the game\" in information verification "
	out += "allows the proliferation of artificial consensus (bots, propaganda).\n\n"
	out += "### Loss of Historical Context\n\n"
	out += "We lose track of what we once believed, preventing us from understanding "
	out += "the evolution of our own logic.\n"
	return out
}

func renderSolution() string {
	out := "## 3. The Solution: The HISTORIA Protocol\n\n"
	out += "HISTORIA introduces a **Commit-Reveal Voting Mechanism** with **One Wallet, One Vote** consensus.\n\n"
	out += "### Consensus Mechanism\n\n"
	out += "**1. PROPOSAL**: A user submits a historical claim with a stake in GNOT.\n\n"
	out += "**2. COMMIT**: Voters deposit a stake and a cryptographically sealed vote (SHA256). "
	out += "No one can see the vote trend.\n\n"
	out += "**3. REVEAL**: Voters open their vote. Those who fail to reveal lose their stake.\n\n"
	out += "**4. RESOLUTION**: The majority defines the \"Archived Truth.\" "
	out += "Winners split the losers' stakes.\n"
	return out
}

func renderTechnical() string {
	out := "## 4. Technical Architecture (Gno.land)\n\n"
	out += "The protocol uses **AVL Tree** data structures to guarantee O(log n) lookups "
	out += "and predictable gas costs.\n\n"
	out += "### Key Parameters\n\n"
	out += "- **One wallet = One vote**: Prevents plutocracy (the wealthy don't decide truth).\n"
	out += "- **Minimum stake (1 GNOT)**: Makes bot attacks (Sybil) economically suicidal.\n"
	out += "- **2% fee**: 1% for the proposer (incentivizes quality), 1% for protocol maintenance.\n\n"
	out += "### Smart Contract\n\n"
	out += "**Realm**: gno.land/r/melonboy314/historiav10\n"
	out += "**Chain**: Gno.land (staging)\n\n"
	out += "**Core Functions**:\n"
	out += "- Submit(description, stake, commitTime, revealTime, hash)\n"
	out += "- CommitVote(eventID, hash)\n"
	out += "- RevealVote(eventID, vote, secret)\n"
	out += "- Resolve(eventID)\n"
	return out
}

func renderEconomics() string {
	out := "## 5. Economic Model (Game Theory)\n\n"
	out += "The protocol creates a **Nash equilibrium** where honesty is the dominant strategy:\n\n"
	out += "- If you vote against the majority consensus (the accepted truth), you lose your stake.\n"
	out += "- Since votes are hidden during the Commit phase, you cannot opportunistically follow the crowd.\n"
	out += "- You must vote according to your conviction and available evidence.\n\n"
	out += "### Stake Redistribution Example\n\n"
	out += "```\n"
	out += "Event: 10 voters × 1 GNOT = 10 GNOT pool\n"
	out += "Outcome: 7 FOR, 3 AGAINST\n"
	out += "Losers pool: 3 GNOT\n"
	out += "Fee (2%): 0.06 GNOT\n"
	out += "  - Proposer: 0.03 GNOT\n"
	out += "  - Founder: 0.03 GNOT\n"
	out += "Distributable: 2.94 GNOT\n"
	out += "Per winner: (2.94 / 7) + 1 GNOT = 1.42 GNOT\n"
	out += "Winner profit: +42% ROI\n"
	out += "```\n"
	return out
}

func renderSecurity() string {
	out := "## 6. Security Considerations\n\n"
	out += "### Sybil Attack Resistance\n\n"
	out += "**Cost to create 1000 fake wallets**:\n"
	out += "- 1000 wallets × 1 GNOT = 1000 GNOT (~$5,000+)\n"
	out += "- If attack fails, entire stake is lost\n"
	out += "- Makes botting economically irrational\n\n"
	out += "### Vote Buying Resistance\n\n"
	out += "**Commit-reveal prevents verification**:\n"
	out += "- Briber cannot verify how you voted\n"
	out += "- Voters can take bribe and defect\n"
	out += "- No way to prove vote direction during commit\n\n"
	out += "### Collusion Resistance\n\n"
	out += "**Blind commitment prevents coordination**:\n"
	out += "- Must commit before seeing others' votes\n"
	out += "- Cannot adjust strategy based on trends\n"
	out += "- Pre-coordination without information is difficult\n\n"
	out += "### Immutability\n\n"
	out += "- No admin keys\n"
	out += "- Cannot pause, upgrade, or modify contracts\n"
	out += "- Cannot change parameters or seize funds\n"
	return out
}

func renderRoadmap() string {
	out := "## 7. Roadmap\n\n"
	out += "### Phase 1: Core Protocol ✅ (Current)\n"
	out += "- ✅ Commit-reveal voting mechanism\n"
	out += "- ✅ Stake redistribution\n"
	out += "- ✅ On-chain user statistics\n"
	out += "- ✅ Frontend (Next.js + Adena)\n\n"
	out += "### Phase 2: Enhanced Features (Q2 2025)\n"
	out += "- Event categories and tags\n"
	out += "- Search and advanced filtering\n"
	out += "- Evidence attachment (IPFS)\n"
	out += "- Notifications system\n\n"
	out += "### Phase 3: Social Layer (Q3 2025)\n"
	out += "- User reputation system\n"
	out += "- Discussion threads per event\n"
	out += "- Leaderboards\n"
	out += "- Following mechanism\n\n"
	out += "### Phase 4: Ecosystem (Q4 2025)\n"
	out += "- Developer API\n"
	out += "- Third-party integrations\n"
	out += "- Academic partnerships\n"
	out += "- Cross-chain bridges\n"
	return out
}

func renderConclusion() string {
	out := "## Conclusion\n\n"
	out += "**HISTORIA is not merely a technological tool—it is a philosophical bulwark.**\n\n"
	out += "It is the mirror of our understanding of the world, captured block by block, "
	out += "transaction by transaction.\n\n"
	out += "By accepting that truth is a changing quest, we give it, for the first time, "
	out += "an immutable foundation.\n\n"
	out += "In archiving not just facts, but the **evolution of human consensus**, HISTORIA becomes:\n\n"
	out += "- A **defense against historical revisionism**\n"
	out += "- A **record of epistemological progress**\n"
	out += "- A **foundation for future understanding**\n\n"
	out += "We do not claim to capture absolute Reality. We archive the Truth of the Moment—"
	out += "and in doing so, we preserve the intellectual honesty of our era for future generations "
	out += "to study, learn from, and transcend.\n\n"
	out += "---\n\n"
	out += "## \"Truth is verified, not dictated.\"\n\n"
	out += "---\n\n"
	out += "**Document Version**: " + version + "\n"
	out += "**Last Updated**: " + date + "\n"
	out += "**License**: CC BY-SA 4.0\n\n"
	out += "*Stored immutably on Gno.land blockchain*\n"
	return out
}

	out += "We do not claim to capture absolute Reality. We archive the Truth of the Moment—"
	out += "and in doing so, we preserve the intellectual honesty of our era for future generations "
	out += "to study, learn from, and transcend.\n\n"
	out += "---\n\n"
	out += "## \"Truth is verified, not dictated.\"\n\n"
	out += "---\n\n"
	out += "**Document Version**: " + version + "\n"
	out += "**Last Updated**: " + date + "\n"

files.name: whitepaper.gno
files.body:
// HISTORIA White Paper - On-chain version
// Immutable documentation stored on Gno.land blockchain
package whitepaper

const (
	version = "1.0"
	date    = "December 2025"
)

// Render returns the white paper content
func Render(path string) string {
	out := "# HISTORIA
"
	out += "## White Paper v" + version + ": The Registry of Epistemological Truth
"
	out += "### Decentralized Protocol for Collective Memory on Gno.land

"
	out += "**Version**: " + version + " | **Date**: " + date + "

"
	out += "---

"

	out += "## 1. Philosophy & Vision

"
	out += "### The Distinction Between Reality and Truth

"
	out += "The foundation of HISTORIA rests on an essential philosophical nuance: "
	out += "the distinction between **Reality** and **Truth**.

"
	out += "**Reality** is a factual, immutable, absolute state.

"
	out += "**Truth** is a human construction—a version of reality validated by knowledge, "
	out += "evidence, and the consensus of a given era.

"

	out += "### The Example of the Earth's Shape

"
	out += "The **Reality** of the Earth's shape has never changed. Yet, the **Truth** about it "
	out += "has radically evolved. During the Renaissance, the collective conviction in a flat Earth "
	out += "was as unshakeable as our current certainty of its sphericity.

"
	out += "**HISTORIA does not claim to capture absolute Reality, but to archive the Truth of the Moment.**

"

	out += "### Our Vision

"
	out += "HISTORIA serves as a **timeline of the evolution of human thought**. "
	out += "By archiving economic and social consensus at a moment T, the protocol protects "
	out += "each stage of our understanding against forgetting or retroactive revisionism.

"
	out += "We create a system where:

"
	out += "- **Truth is verified, not dictated.**
"
	out += "- **Economic alignment ensures honesty.**
"
	out += "- **Epistemological humility is the rule**: we accept that today's truth may be tomorrow's historical curiosity.

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## 2. Problem Statement

"
	out += "### Centralized Revisionism

"
	out += "Current databases (Wikipedia, state servers) are mutable. "
	out += "A past truth can be erased to match present needs.

"
	out += "### Crisis of Trust

"
	out += "The absence of "skin in the game" in information verification "
	out += "allows the proliferation of artificial consensus (bots, propaganda).

"
	out += "### Loss of Historical Context

"
	out += "We lose track of what we once believed, preventing us from understanding "
	out += "the evolution of our own logic.

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## 3. The Solution: The HISTORIA Protocol

"
	out += "HISTORIA introduces a **Commit-Reveal Voting Mechanism** with **One Wallet, One Vote** consensus.

"
	out += "### Consensus Mechanism

"
	out += "**1. PROPOSAL**: A user submits a historical claim with a stake in GNOT.

"
	out += "**2. COMMIT**: Voters deposit a stake and a cryptographically sealed vote (SHA256). "
	out += "No one can see the vote trend.

"
	out += "**3. REVEAL**: Voters open their vote. Those who fail to reveal lose their stake.

"
	out += "**4. RESOLUTION**: The majority defines the "Archived Truth." "
	out += "Winners split the losers' stakes.

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## 4. Technical Architecture (Gno.land)

"
	out += "The protocol uses **AVL Tree** data structures to guarantee O(log n) lookups "
	out += "and predictable gas costs.

"
	out += "### Key Parameters

"
	out += "- **One wallet = One vote**: Prevents plutocracy (the wealthy don't decide truth).
"
	out += "- **Minimum stake (1 GNOT)**: Makes bot attacks (Sybil) economically suicidal.
"
	out += "- **2% fee**: 1% for the proposer (incentivizes quality), 1% for protocol maintenance.

"
	out += "### Smart Contract

"
	out += "**Realm**: gno.land/r/melonboy314/historiav10
"
	out += "**Chain**: Gno.land (staging) then (mainnet)

"
	out += "**Core Functions**:

"
	out += "- Submit(description, stake, commitTime, revealTime, hash)
"
	out += "- CommitVote(eventID, hash)
"
	out += "- RevealVote(eventID, vote, secret)
"
	out += "- Resolve(eventID)

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## 5. Economic Model (Game Theory)

"
	out += "The protocol creates a **Nash equilibrium** where honesty is the dominant strategy:

"
	out += "- If you vote against the majority consensus (the accepted truth), you lose your stake.
"
	out += "- Since votes are hidden during the Commit phase, you cannot opportunistically follow the crowd.
"
	out += "- You must vote according to your conviction and available evidence.

"
	out += "### Stake Redistribution Example

"
	out += "```
"
	out += "Event: 10 voters × 1 GNOT = 10 GNOT pool
"
	out += "Outcome: 7 FOR, 3 AGAINST
"
	out += "Losers pool: 3 GNOT
"
	out += "Fee (2%): 0.06 GNOT
"
	out += "  - Proposer: 0.03 GNOT
"
	out += "  - Founder: 0.03 GNOT
"
	out += "Distributable: 2.94 GNOT
"
	out += "Per winner: (2.94 / 7) + 1 GNOT = 1.42 GNOT
"
	out += "Winner profit: +42% ROI
"
	out += "```

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## 6. Security Considerations

"
	out += "### Sybil Attack Resistance

"
	out += "**Cost to create 1000 fake wallets**:

"
	out += "- 1000 wallets × 1 GNOT = 1000 GNOT (~$5,000+)
"
	out += "- If attack fails, entire stake is lost
"
	out += "- Makes botting economically irrational

"
	out += "### Vote Buying Resistance

"
	out += "**Commit-reveal prevents verification**:

"
	out += "- Briber cannot verify how you voted
"
	out += "- Voters can take bribe and defect
"
	out += "- No way to prove vote direction during commit

"
	out += "### Collusion Resistance

"
	out += "**Blind commitment prevents coordination**:

"
	out += "- Must commit before seeing others' votes
"
	out += "- Cannot adjust strategy based on trends
"
	out += "- Pre-coordination without information is difficult

"
	out += "### Immutability

"
	out += "- No admin keys
"
	out += "- Cannot pause, upgrade, or modify contracts
"
	out += "- Cannot change parameters or seize funds

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## Conclusion

"
	out += "**HISTORIA is not merely a technological tool—it is a philosophical bulwark.**

"
	out += "It is the mirror of our understanding of the world, captured block by block, "
	out += "transaction by transaction.

"
	out += "By accepting that truth is a changing quest, we give it, for the first time, "
	out += "an immutable foundation.

"
	out += "In archiving not just facts, but the **evolution of human consensus**, HISTORIA becomes:

"
	out += "- A **defense against historical revisionism**
"
	out += "- A **record of epistemological progress**
"
	out += "- A **foundation for future understanding**

"
	out += "We do not claim to capture absolute Reality. We archive the Truth of the Moment—"
	out += "and in doing so, we preserve the intellectual honesty of our era for future generations "
	out += "to study, learn from, and transcend.

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "## "Truth is verified, not dictated."

"

	out += "---

"

	out += "**Document Version**: " + version + "
"
	out += "**Last Updated**: " + date + "

"
	out += "*Stored immutably on Gno.land blockchain*
"

	return out
}

files.body:
package runtime

type Language string

const (
	French    Language = "french"
	Italian   Language = "italian"
	Spanish   Language = "spanish"
	Hindi     Language = "hindi"
	Bulgarian Language = "bulgarian"
	Serbian   Language = "serbian"
)

// GetGreeting generates a greeting in
// the specified language
func GetGreeting(language Language) string {
	switch language {
	case French:
		return "Bonjour"
	case Italian:
		return "Ciao"
	case Spanish:
		return "Hola"
	case Hindi:
		return "नमस्ते"
	case Bulgarian:
		return "Здравейте"
	case Serbian:
		return "Здраво"
	default:
		return "Hello"
	}
}
